info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 03 at 3:18AM PDT until August 04 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...Lightning Activity Will Increase Today Into Friday... .Monsoonal moisture and an upper level low will kick off thunderstorm activity east of the Cascades this afternoon. Storm activity has a moderate chance of continuing overnight, then increased coverage of thunderstorm activity is anticipated from the Cascades eastward and in Siskiyou County Friday. Storms on Thursday and Friday have a high potential of being dry. A slight chance of thunderstorms will follow on Saturday afternoon. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 11 PM PDT FRIDAY FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING ON DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 285 AND 624... * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop have a high probability of spreading rapidly. Abundant lightning under wetter storms can also ignite new fires and strain fire fighting resources. * AFFECTED AREA...The entire area of fire weather zones 285 and 624. Storms are anticipated to be isolated within eastern portions of these zones this afternoon and evening, before activity increases on Friday. * THUNDERSTORMS...Storms have a higher potential of being dry. The probability of lightning within 25 miles of any point in the warning area is roughly 40 percent Friday. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Gusts up to 40 mph. * ADDITIONAL INFO...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Find links to restrictions at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less wildfire. Gather your fire evacuation kit now. Collect essentials you don`t want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Where will you go? How will you get there? Who will you call to let others know your are safe? Visit ready.gov/wildfires for more information. A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. These conditions promote rapid spread of fire which may become life threatening. Evacuate if ordered to, or if a fire threatens.
